explanation: looking the same in every part, usually in a way that most people consider to be boring
sentence: The countryside is flat and featureless.
The forests are chiefly composed of oak, fir, pine, ash and alder.
sentence_gap: The forests are chiefly composed of oak, ___, pine, ash and alder.

explanation: to make someone feel that they must do something
sentence: I wonder what it is that impels him to exercise all the time.
sentence_gap: I wonder what it is that ______ him to exercise all the time.

explanation: formal; a particular point in time
sentence: At this juncture, it is impossible to say whether she will make a full recovery.
sentence_gap: At this ________, it is impossible to say whether she will make a full recovery.

explanation: to press something, especially a mixture for making bread, firmly and repeatedly with the hands and fingers
(of plants, gardens, etc.) growing thickly and strongly in a way that is attractive; covered in healthy grass and plants
sentence: The lake, with its lush scenery, is a favorite with canoeists.
sentence_gap: The lake, with its ____ scenery, is a favorite with canoeists.

explanation: great suffering of the mind or body
sentence: Fame brought her nothing but misery.

explanation: (of people or animals) to move through a place in a group, usually breaking things and causing damage
sentence: Several thousand demonstrators rampaged through the center of the city.
sentence_gap: Several thousand demonstrators ________ through the center of the city.

explanation: formal; the quality of being strange
sentence: He has been behaving with great singularity.
sentence_gap: He has been behaving with great ___________.

explanation: an area like a wide wall built near the edge of the sea or a river where ships can be tied and goods can be taken off them
sentence: The crates were unloaded onto the wharf.
sentence_gap: The crates were unloaded onto the _____.
